front.title: Private Information Queries: problem statement and overview

abstract.t: Private Information Queries (PIQ) is an Internet protocol that allows making a phone number query directly to the target cell phone. The target user can decide whether or not a phone number should be returned; in real-time and on a case-by-case basis. PIQ may also be used for bootstrapping IKEv2 (Internet Key Exchange). Along with a phone number, the querier can securely obtain a fixed IP address e.g., a Mobile IPv6 home address, exchange certificates and initiate IKEv2 with the target host.
